intro: Erucastrum incanum var. geniculatum, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruit is a slender, elongated pod that contains several seeds. It is typically found in dry, disturbed soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
